title: Foreign Secy plants 3 saplings of Chinar to pay tribute to three generations of Kashmiris under Indian siege
content:
ISLAMABAD, Oct 27 (APP): Foreign Secretary Sohail Mahmood on Wednesday planted three saplings of Chinar (maple) tree to pay tribute to the three generations of Kashmiris facing Indian oppression.
The saplings of Chinar, the native tree of the Kashmir Valley, was planted in the lawns of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs to observe the Kashmir Black Day.
The Foreign Secretary on the occasion said the gesture was to pay tribute to Kashmirisâ€™ struggle for self- determination and supreme sacrifices by their three generations who braved the 74 years of Illegal Indian occupation.
